DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today Anything Else Made You Feel Bad or Sick Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of whether or not anything else made them feel bad or sick yesterday or today, using a coded yes or no response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (MSAS) 7-12 Yesterday or Today Anything Else Made You Feel Bad or Sick
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated questionnaire designed to evaluate the prevalence, characteristics, and distress to young children with cancer aged 7-12. This 8-question instrument was adapted from a previously-validated adult version._The time period consisting of the current day and the preceding day._A question about whether an individual has had anything else make them feel bad or sick.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: If you had anything else whic
ReferenceDocuments.description: If you had anything else which made you feel bad or sick yesterday or today, write it here:

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

DataElement.origin: MSAS 7-10: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale (7-10). J. Collins, et al. Journal of Pain and Symptom Management. 2002 Jan; 23(1): 10-16
